../deps/v8/src/tracing/trace-event.h

1// Copyright 2015 the V8 project authors. All rights reserved.
2// Use of this source code is governed by a BSD-style license that can be
3// found in the LICENSE file.
4
5#ifndef V8_TRACING_TRACE_EVENT_H_
6#define V8_TRACING_TRACE_EVENT_H_
7
8#include <stddef.h>
9#include <memory>
10
11#if defined(V8_USE_PERFETTO)
12#include "protos/perfetto/trace/track_event/debug_annotation.pbzero.h"
13#include "src/tracing/trace-categories.h"
14#else
15#include "base/trace_event/common/trace_event_common.h"
16#endif // !defined(V8_USE_PERFETTO)
17
18#include "include/v8-platform.h"
19#include "src/base/atomicops.h"
20#include "src/base/macros.h"
21
22// This header file defines implementation details of how the trace macros in
23// trace_event_common.h collect and store trace events. Anything not
24// implementation-specific should go in trace_macros_common.h instead of here.
25
26
27// The pointer returned from GetCategoryGroupEnabled() points to a
28// value with zero or more of the following bits. Used in this class only.
29// The TRACE_EVENT macros should only use the value as a bool.
30// These values must be in sync with macro values in trace_log.h in
31// chromium.
32enum CategoryGroupEnabledFlags {
33 // Category group enabled for the recording mode.
34 kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags = 1 << 0,
35 // Category group enabled by SetEventCallbackEnabled().
36 kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags = 1 << 2,
37 // Category group enabled to export events to ETW.
38 kEnabledForETWExport_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags = 1 << 3,
39};
40
41#if !defined(V8_USE_PERFETTO)
42
43// TODO(petermarshall): Remove with the old tracing implementation - Perfetto
44// copies const char* arguments by default.
45// By default, const char* argument values are assumed to have long-lived scope
46// and will not be copied. Use this macro to force a const char* to be copied.
47#define TRACE_STR_COPY(str)v8::internal::tracing::TraceStringWithCopy(str) v8::internal::tracing::TraceStringWithCopy(str)
48
49// By default, trace IDs are eventually converted to a single 64-bit number. Use
50// this macro to add a scope string.
51#define TRACE_ID_WITH_SCOPE(scope, id)v8::internal::tracing::TraceID::WithScope(scope, id) \
52 v8::internal::tracing::TraceID::WithScope(scope, id)
53
54#define INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_CATEGORY_GROUP_ENABLED_FOR_RECORDING_MODE()v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base::Atomic8
*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled54)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
| kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags) \
55 TRACE_EVENT_API_LOAD_CATEGORY_GROUP_ENABLED()v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base::Atomic8
*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled55)) & \
56 (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | \
57 kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags)
58
59// The following macro has no implementation, but it needs to exist since
60// it gets called from scoped trace events. It cannot call UNIMPLEMENTED()
61// since an empty implementation is a valid one.
62#define INTERNAL_TRACE_MEMORY(category, name)
63
64////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
65// Implementation specific tracing API definitions.
66
67// Get a pointer to the enabled state of the given trace category. Only
68// long-lived literal strings should be given as the category group. The
69// returned pointer can be held permanently in a local static for example. If
70// the unsigned char is non-zero, tracing is enabled. If tracing is enabled,
71// TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENT can be called. It's OK if tracing is disabled
72// between the load of the tracing state and the call to
73// TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENT, because this flag only provides an early out
74// for best performance when tracing is disabled.
75// const uint8_t*
76// TRACE_EVENT_API_GET_CATEGORY_GROUP_ENABLED(const char* category_group)
77#define TRACE_EVENT_API_GET_CATEGORY_GROUP_ENABLEDv8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled \
78 v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController() \
79 ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled
80
81// Get the number of times traces have been recorded. This is used to implement
82// the TRACE_EVENT_IS_NEW_TRACE facility.
83// unsigned int TRACE_EVENT_API_GET_NUM_TRACES_RECORDED()
84#define TRACE_EVENT_API_GET_NUM_TRACES_RECORDEDV8_Fatal("unimplemented code") UNIMPLEMENTED()V8_Fatal("unimplemented code")
85
86// Add a trace event to the platform tracing system.
87// uint64_t TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENT(
88// char phase,
89// const uint8_t* category_group_enabled,
90// const char* name,
91// const char* scope,
92// uint64_t id,
93// uint64_t bind_id,
94// int num_args,
95// const char** arg_names,
96// const uint8_t* arg_types,
97// const uint64_t* arg_values,
98// unsigned int flags)
99#define TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENTv8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventImpl v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventImpl
100
101// Add a trace event to the platform tracing system.
102// uint64_t TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENT_WITH_TIMESTAMP(
103// char phase,
104// const uint8_t* category_group_enabled,
105// const char* name,
106// const char* scope,
107// uint64_t id,
108// uint64_t bind_id,
109// int num_args,
110// const char** arg_names,
111// const uint8_t* arg_types,
112// const uint64_t* arg_values,
113// unsigned int flags,
114// int64_t timestamp)
115#define TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENT_WITH_TIMESTAMPv8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventWithTimestampImpl \
116 v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventWithTimestampImpl
117
118// Set the duration field of a COMPLETE trace event.
119// void TRACE_EVENT_API_UPDATE_TRACE_EVENT_DURATION(
120// const uint8_t* category_group_enabled,
121// const char* name,
122// uint64_t id)
123#define TRACE_EVENT_API_UPDATE_TRACE_EVENT_DURATIONv8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->UpdateTraceEventDuration \
124 v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController() \
125 ->UpdateTraceEventDuration
126
127// Defines atomic operations used internally by the tracing system.
128#define TRACE_EVENT_API_ATOMIC_WORDv8::base::AtomicWord v8::base::AtomicWord
129#define TRACE_EVENT_API_ATOMIC_LOAD(var)v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(var)) v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(var))
130#define TRACE_EVENT_API_ATOMIC_STORE(var, value)v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(var), (value)) \
131 v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(var), (value))
132#define TRACE_EVENT_API_LOAD_CATEGORY_GROUP_ENABLED()v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base::Atomic8
*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled132)) \
133 v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base::Atomic8*>( \
134 INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID(category_group_enabled)trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled134))
135
136////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
137
138// Implementation detail: trace event macros create temporary variables
139// to keep instrumentation overhead low. These macros give each temporary
140// variable a unique name based on the line number to prevent name collisions.
141#define INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID3(a, b)trace_event_unique_ab trace_event_unique_##a##b
142#define INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID2(a, b)trace_event_unique_ab INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID3(a, b)trace_event_unique_ab
143#define INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID(name_prefix)trace_event_unique_name_prefix143 \
144 INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID2(name_prefix, __LINE__)trace_event_unique_name_prefix144
145
146// Implementation detail: internal macro to create static category.
147// No barriers are needed, because this code is designed to operate safely
148// even when the unsigned char* points to garbage data (which may be the case
149// on processors without cache coherency).
150// TODO(fmeawad): This implementation contradicts that we can have a different
151// configuration for each isolate,
152// https://code.google.com/p/v8/issues/detail?id=4563
153#define INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_GET_CATEGORY_INFO_CUSTOM_VARIABLES( \category_group_enabled = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>
(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(atomic))); if (!category_group_enabled
) { category_group_enabled = v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper
::GetTracingController() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group
); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(atomic), (reinterpret_cast<
v8::base::AtomicWord>( category_group_enabled))); }
154 category_group, atomic, category_group_enabled)category_group_enabled = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>
(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(atomic))); if (!category_group_enabled
) { category_group_enabled = v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper
::GetTracingController() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group
); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(atomic), (reinterpret_cast<
v8::base::AtomicWord>( category_group_enabled))); } \
155 category_group_enabled = \
156 reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(TRACE_EVENT_API_ATOMIC_LOAD(atomic)v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(atomic))); \
157 if (!category_group_enabled) { \
158 category_group_enabled = \
159 TRACE_EVENT_API_GET_CATEGORY_GROUP_ENABLEDv8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); \
160 TRACE_EVENT_API_ATOMIC_STORE( \v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(atomic), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( category_group_enabled)))
161 atomic, reinterpret_cast<TRACE_EVENT_API_ATOMIC_WORD>( \v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(atomic), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( category_group_enabled)))
162 category_group_enabled))v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(atomic), (reinterpret_cast<v8

172// Implementation detail: internal macro to create static category and add
173// event if the category is enabled.

::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled174
))); };; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const
v8::base::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled174
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( phase, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled174

::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, flags, ...); } } while

185// Implementation detail: internal macro to create static category and add begin
186// event if the category is enabled. Also adds the end event when the scope
187// ends.

(&(trace_event_unique_atomic188), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled188
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer188
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled188)
) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled188, name, v8::internal
::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal

202#define INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_ADD_SCOPED_WITH_FLOW(category_group, name, \static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic203 = 0;
const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203;
trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic203
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic203), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer203
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203)
) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { unsigned int trace_event_flags = flow_flags; v8::internal
::tracing::TraceID trace_event_bind_id(bind_id, &trace_event_flags
); uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X'), trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203
, name, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing
::kNoId, trace_event_bind_id.raw_id(), trace_event_flags, ...
); trace_event_unique_tracer203 .Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203
, name, h); }
203 bind_id, flow_flags, ...)static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic203 = 0;
const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203;
trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic203
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic203), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer203
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203)
) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { unsigned int trace_event_flags = flow_flags; v8::internal
::tracing::TraceID trace_event_bind_id(bind_id, &trace_event_flags
); uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X'), trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203
, name, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing
::kNoId, trace_event_bind_id.raw_id(), trace_event_flags, ...
); trace_event_unique_tracer203 .Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled203
, name, h); } \
204 INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_GET_CATEGORY_INFO(category_group)static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic204 = 0;
const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled204;
trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled204 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic204
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled204) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled204
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic204), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled204
))); };; \
205 v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID(tracer)trace_event_unique_tracer205; \
206 if (INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_CATEGORY_GROUP_ENABLED_FOR_RECORDING_MODE()v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base::Atomic8
*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled206)) & (
kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { \
207 unsigned int trace_event_flags = flow_flags; \
208 v8::internal::tracing::TraceID trace_event_bind_id(bind_id, \
209 &trace_event_flags); \
210 uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( \
211 TRACE_EVENT_PHASE_COMPLETE('X'), \
212 INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID(category_group_enabled)trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled212, name, \
213 v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, \
214 trace_event_bind_id.raw_id(), trace_event_flags, ##__VA_ARGS__); \
215 INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID(tracer)trace_event_unique_tracer215 \
216 .Initialize(INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID(category_group_enabled)trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled216, name, \
217 h); \
218 }
219
220// Implementation detail: internal macro to create static category and add
221// event if the category is enabled.
222#define INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_ADD_WITH_ID(phase, category_group, name, id, \do { static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic223
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic223
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic223), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223
))); };; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const
v8::base::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { unsigned int trace_event_flags = flags | (static_cast<
unsigned int>(1 << 1)); v8::internal::tracing::TraceID
trace_event_trace_id(id, &trace_event_flags); v8::internal
::tracing::AddTraceEvent( phase, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223
, name, trace_event_trace_id.scope(), trace_event_trace_id.raw_id
(), v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, trace_event_flags, ...); } }
while (false)
223 flags, ...)do { static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic223
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic223
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic223), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223
))); };; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const
v8::base::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { unsigned int trace_event_flags = flags | (static_cast<
unsigned int>(1 << 1)); v8::internal::tracing::TraceID
trace_event_trace_id(id, &trace_event_flags); v8::internal
::tracing::AddTraceEvent( phase, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled223
, name, trace_event_trace_id.scope(), trace_event_trace_id.raw_id
(), v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, trace_event_flags, ...); } }
while (false) \
224 do { \
225 INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_GET_CATEGORY_INFO(category_group)static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic225 = 0;
const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled225;
trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled225 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic225
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled225) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled225
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic225), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled225
))); };; \
226 if (INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_CATEGORY_GROUP_ENABLED_FOR_RECORDING_MODE()v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base::Atomic8
*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled226)) & (
kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { \
227 unsigned int trace_event_flags = flags | TRACE_EVENT_FLAG_HAS_ID(static_cast<unsigned int>(1 << 1)); \
228 v8::internal::tracing::TraceID trace_event_trace_id(id, \
229 &trace_event_flags); \
230 v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( \
231 phase, INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID(category_group_enabled)trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled231, name, \
232 trace_event_trace_id.scope(), trace_event_trace_id.raw_id(), \
233 v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, trace_event_flags, ##__VA_ARGS__); \
234 } \
235 } while (false)

237// Adds a trace event with a given timestamp.

() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic239), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled239
))); };; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const
v8::base::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled239
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventWithTimestamp( phase
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled239, name, v8::internal
::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal
::tracing::kNoId, flags, timestamp, ...); } } while (false)

267// Adds a trace event with a given id, thread_id, and timestamp. This redirects
268// to INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_ADD_WITH_ID_AND_TIMESTAMP as we presently do not care
269// about the thread id.

= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled271

(&(trace_event_unique_atomic271), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled271
))); };; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const
v8::base::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled271
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { unsigned int trace_event_flags = flags | (static_cast<

::tracing::AddTraceEventWithTimestamp( phase, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled271
, name, trace_event_trace_id.scope(), trace_event_trace_id.raw_id

, ...); } } while (false)

275#define TRACE_EVENT_CALL_STATS_SCOPED(isolate, category_group, name)static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic275 = 0;
const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled275;
trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled275 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic275
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled275) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled275
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic275), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled275
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::CallStatsScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer275
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled275)
) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { trace_event_unique_tracer275 .Initialize(isolate, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled275
, name); } \
276 INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_CALL_STATS_SCOPED(isolate, category_group, name)static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic276 = 0;

<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic276
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled276) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled276
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic276), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled276
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::CallStatsScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer276
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled276)
) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { trace_event_unique_tracer276 .Initialize(isolate, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled276
, name); }

278#define INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_CALL_STATS_SCOPED(isolate, category_group, name)static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic278 = 0;
const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled278;
trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled278 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic278
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled278) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled278
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic278), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled278
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::CallStatsScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer278
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled278)
) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { trace_event_unique_tracer278 .Initialize(isolate, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled278
, name); } \
279 INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_GET_CATEGORY_INFO(category_group)static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic279 = 0;
const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled279;
trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled279 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic279
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled279) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled279
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category_group); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic279), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled279
))); };; \
280 v8::internal::tracing::CallStatsScopedTracer INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID( \trace_event_unique_tracer281
281 tracer)trace_event_unique_tracer281; \
282 if (INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_CATEGORY_GROUP_ENABLED_FOR_RECORDING_MODE()v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base::Atomic8
*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled282)) & (
kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { \
283 INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID(tracer)trace_event_unique_tracer283 \
284 .Initialize(isolate, INTERNAL_TRACE_EVENT_UID(category_group_enabled)trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled284, \
285 name); \
286 }

288namespace v8 {
289namespace internal {

291class Isolate;

293namespace tracing {
294
295// Specify these values when the corresponding argument of AddTraceEvent
296// is not used.
297const int kZeroNumArgs = 0;
298const decltype(nullptr) kGlobalScope = nullptr;
299const uint64_t kNoId = 0;
300
301class TraceEventHelper {
302 public:
303 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static v8::TracingController* GetTracingController();
304};
305
306// TraceID encapsulates an ID that can either be an integer or pointer.
307class TraceID {
308 public:
309 class WithScope {
310 public:
311 WithScope(const char* scope, uint64_t raw_id)
312 : scope_(scope), raw_id_(raw_id) {}
313 uint64_t raw_id() const { return raw_id_; }
314 const char* scope() const { return scope_; }
315
316 private:
317 const char* scope_ = nullptr;
318 uint64_t raw_id_;
319 };
320
321 TraceID(const void* raw_id, unsigned int* flags)
322 : raw_id_(static_cast<uint64_t>(reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(raw_id))) {}
323 TraceID(uint64_t raw_id, unsigned int* flags) : raw_id_(raw_id) {
324 (void)flags;
325 }
326 TraceID(unsigned int raw_id, unsigned int* flags) : raw_id_(raw_id) {
327 (void)flags;
328 }
329 TraceID(uint16_t raw_id, unsigned int* flags) : raw_id_(raw_id) {
330 (void)flags;
331 }
332 TraceID(unsigned char raw_id, unsigned int* flags) : raw_id_(raw_id) {
333 (void)flags;
334 }
335 TraceID(int64_t raw_id, unsigned int* flags)
336 : raw_id_(static_cast<uint64_t>(raw_id)) {
337 (void)flags;
338 }
339 TraceID(int raw_id, unsigned int* flags)
340 : raw_id_(static_cast<uint64_t>(raw_id)) {
341 (void)flags;
342 }
343 TraceID(int16_t raw_id, unsigned int* flags)
344 : raw_id_(static_cast<uint64_t>(raw_id)) {
345 (void)flags;
346 }
347 TraceID(signed char raw_id, unsigned int* flags)
348 : raw_id_(static_cast<uint64_t>(raw_id)) {
349 (void)flags;
350 }
351 TraceID(WithScope scoped_id, unsigned int* flags)
352 : scope_(scoped_id.scope()), raw_id_(scoped_id.raw_id()) {}
353
354 uint64_t raw_id() const { return raw_id_; }
355 const char* scope() const { return scope_; }
356
357 private:
358 const char* scope_ = nullptr;
359 uint64_t raw_id_;
360};
361
362// Simple container for const char* that should be copied instead of retained.
363class TraceStringWithCopy {
364 public:
365 explicit TraceStringWithCopy(const char* str) : str_(str) {}
366 operator const char*() const { return str_; }
367
368 private:
369 const char* str_;
370};
371
372static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) uint64_t AddTraceEventImpl(
373 char phase, const uint8_t* category_group_enabled, const char* name,
374 const char* scope, uint64_t id, uint64_t bind_id, int32_t num_args,
375 const char** arg_names, const uint8_t* arg_types,
376 const uint64_t* arg_values, unsigned int flags) {
377 std::unique_ptr<ConvertableToTraceFormat> arg_convertables[2];
378 if (num_args > 0 && arg_types[0] == TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_CONVERTABLE(static_cast<unsigned char>(8))) {
379 arg_convertables[0].reset(reinterpret_cast<ConvertableToTraceFormat*>(
380 static_cast<intptr_t>(arg_values[0])));
381 }
382 if (num_args > 1 && arg_types[1] == TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_CONVERTABLE(static_cast<unsigned char>(8))) {
383 arg_convertables[1].reset(reinterpret_cast<ConvertableToTraceFormat*>(
384 static_cast<intptr_t>(arg_values[1])));
385 }
386 DCHECK_LE(num_args, 2)((void) 0);
387 v8::TracingController* controller =
388 v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController();
389 return controller->AddTraceEvent(phase, category_group_enabled, name, scope,
390 id, bind_id, num_args, arg_names, arg_types,
391 arg_values, arg_convertables, flags);
392}
393
394static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) uint64_t AddTraceEventWithTimestampImpl(
395 char phase, const uint8_t* category_group_enabled, const char* name,
396 const char* scope, uint64_t id, uint64_t bind_id, int32_t num_args,
397 const char** arg_names, const uint8_t* arg_types,
398 const uint64_t* arg_values, unsigned int flags, int64_t timestamp) {
399 std::unique_ptr<ConvertableToTraceFormat> arg_convertables[2];
400 if (num_args > 0 && arg_types[0] == TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_CONVERTABLE(static_cast<unsigned char>(8))) {
401 arg_convertables[0].reset(reinterpret_cast<ConvertableToTraceFormat*>(
402 static_cast<intptr_t>(arg_values[0])));
403 }
404 if (num_args > 1 && arg_types[1] == TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_CONVERTABLE(static_cast<unsigned char>(8))) {
405 arg_convertables[1].reset(reinterpret_cast<ConvertableToTraceFormat*>(
406 static_cast<intptr_t>(arg_values[1])));
407 }
408 DCHECK_LE(num_args, 2)((void) 0);
409 v8::TracingController* controller =
410 v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController();
411 return controller->AddTraceEventWithTimestamp(
412 phase, category_group_enabled, name, scope, id, bind_id, num_args,
413 arg_names, arg_types, arg_values, arg_convertables, flags, timestamp);
414}
415
416// Define SetTraceValue for each allowed type. It stores the type and
417// value in the return arguments. This allows this API to avoid declaring any
418// structures so that it is portable to third_party libraries.
419// This is the base implementation for integer types (including bool) and enums.
420template <typename T>
421static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) typename std::enable_if<
422 std::is_integral<T>::value || std::is_enum<T>::value, void>::type
423SetTraceValue(T arg, unsigned char* type, uint64_t* value) {
424 *type = std::is_same<T, bool>::value
425 ? TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_BOOL(static_cast<unsigned char>(1))
426 : std::is_signed<T>::value ? TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_INT(static_cast<unsigned char>(3))
427 : TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_UINT(static_cast<unsigned char>(2));
428 *value = static_cast<uint64_t>(arg);
429}
430
431#define INTERNAL_DECLARE_SET_TRACE_VALUE(actual_type, value_type_id) \
432 static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void SetTraceValue(actual_type arg, unsigned char* type, \
433 uint64_t* value) { \
434 *type = value_type_id; \
435 *value = 0; \
436 STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof(arg) <= sizeof(*value))static_assert(sizeof(arg) <= sizeof(*value), "sizeof(arg) <= sizeof(*value)"
); \
437 memcpy(value, &arg, sizeof(arg)); \
438 }
439INTERNAL_DECLARE_SET_TRACE_VALUE(double, TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_DOUBLE(static_cast<unsigned char>(4)))
440INTERNAL_DECLARE_SET_TRACE_VALUE(const void*, TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_POINTER(static_cast<unsigned char>(5)))
441INTERNAL_DECLARE_SET_TRACE_VALUE(const char*, TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_STRING(static_cast<unsigned char>(6)))
442INTERNAL_DECLARE_SET_TRACE_VALUE(const TraceStringWithCopy&,
443 TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_COPY_STRING(static_cast<unsigned char>(7)))
444#undef INTERNAL_DECLARE_SET_TRACE_VALUE
445
446static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void SetTraceValue(ConvertableToTraceFormat* convertable_value,
447 unsigned char* type, uint64_t* value) {
448 *type = TRACE_VALUE_TYPE_CONVERTABLE(static_cast<unsigned char>(8));
449 *value = static_cast<uint64_t>(reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(convertable_value));
450}
451
452template <typename T>
453static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) typename std::enable_if<
454 std::is_convertible<T*, ConvertableToTraceFormat*>::value>::type
455SetTraceValue(std::unique_ptr<T> ptr, unsigned char* type, uint64_t* value) {
456 SetTraceValue(ptr.release(), type, value);
457}
458
459// These AddTraceEvent template
460// function is defined here instead of in the macro, because the arg_values
461// could be temporary objects, such as std::string. In order to store
462// pointers to the internal c_str and pass through to the tracing API,
463// the arg_values must live throughout these procedures.
464
465static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) uint64_t AddTraceEvent(char phase,
466 const uint8_t* category_group_enabled,
467 const char* name, const char* scope,
468 uint64_t id, uint64_t bind_id,
469 unsigned int flags) {
470 return TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENTv8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventImpl(phase, category_group_enabled, name,
471 scope, id, bind_id, kZeroNumArgs,
472 nullptr, nullptr, nullptr, flags);
473}
474
475template <class ARG1_TYPE>
476static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) uint64_t AddTraceEvent(
477 char phase, const uint8_t* category_group_enabled, const char* name,
478 const char* scope, uint64_t id, uint64_t bind_id, unsigned int flags,
479 const char* arg1_name, ARG1_TYPE&& arg1_val) {
480 const int num_args = 1;
481 uint8_t arg_type;
482 uint64_t arg_value;
483 SetTraceValue(std::forward<ARG1_TYPE>(arg1_val), &arg_type, &arg_value);
484 return TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENTv8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventImpl(
485 phase, category_group_enabled, name, scope, id, bind_id, num_args,
486 &arg1_name, &arg_type, &arg_value, flags);
487}
488
489template <class ARG1_TYPE, class ARG2_TYPE>
490static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) uint64_t AddTraceEvent(
491 char phase, const uint8_t* category_group_enabled, const char* name,
492 const char* scope, uint64_t id, uint64_t bind_id, unsigned int flags,
493 const char* arg1_name, ARG1_TYPE&& arg1_val, const char* arg2_name,
494 ARG2_TYPE&& arg2_val) {
495 const int num_args = 2;
496 const char* arg_names[2] = {arg1_name, arg2_name};
497 unsigned char arg_types[2];
498 uint64_t arg_values[2];
499 SetTraceValue(std::forward<ARG1_TYPE>(arg1_val), &arg_types[0],
500 &arg_values[0]);
501 SetTraceValue(std::forward<ARG2_TYPE>(arg2_val), &arg_types[1],
502 &arg_values[1]);
503 return TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENTv8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventImpl(
504 phase, category_group_enabled, name, scope, id, bind_id, num_args,
505 arg_names, arg_types, arg_values, flags);
506}
507
508static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) uint64_t AddTraceEventWithTimestamp(
509 char phase, const uint8_t* category_group_enabled, const char* name,
510 const char* scope, uint64_t id, uint64_t bind_id, unsigned int flags,
511 int64_t timestamp) {
512 return TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENT_WITH_TIMESTAMPv8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventWithTimestampImpl(
513 phase, category_group_enabled, name, scope, id, bind_id, kZeroNumArgs,
514 nullptr, nullptr, nullptr, flags, timestamp);
515}
516
517template <class ARG1_TYPE>
518static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) uint64_t AddTraceEventWithTimestamp(
519 char phase, const uint8_t* category_group_enabled, const char* name,
520 const char* scope, uint64_t id, uint64_t bind_id, unsigned int flags,
521 int64_t timestamp, const char* arg1_name, ARG1_TYPE&& arg1_val) {
522 const int num_args = 1;
523 uint8_t arg_type;
524 uint64_t arg_value;
525 SetTraceValue(std::forward<ARG1_TYPE>(arg1_val), &arg_type, &arg_value);
526 return TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENT_WITH_TIMESTAMPv8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventWithTimestampImpl(
527 phase, category_group_enabled, name, scope, id, bind_id, num_args,
528 &arg1_name, &arg_type, &arg_value, flags, timestamp);
529}
530
531template <class ARG1_TYPE, class ARG2_TYPE>
532static V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) uint64_t AddTraceEventWithTimestamp(
533 char phase, const uint8_t* category_group_enabled, const char* name,
534 const char* scope, uint64_t id, uint64_t bind_id, unsigned int flags,
535 int64_t timestamp, const char* arg1_name, ARG1_TYPE&& arg1_val,
536 const char* arg2_name, ARG2_TYPE&& arg2_val) {
537 const int num_args = 2;
538 const char* arg_names[2] = {arg1_name, arg2_name};
539 unsigned char arg_types[2];
540 uint64_t arg_values[2];
541 SetTraceValue(std::forward<ARG1_TYPE>(arg1_val), &arg_types[0],
542 &arg_values[0]);
543 SetTraceValue(std::forward<ARG2_TYPE>(arg2_val), &arg_types[1],
544 &arg_values[1]);
545 return TRACE_EVENT_API_ADD_TRACE_EVENT_WITH_TIMESTAMPv8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEventWithTimestampImpl(
546 phase, category_group_enabled, name, scope, id, bind_id, num_args,
547 arg_names, arg_types, arg_values, flags, timestamp);
548}
549
550// Used by TRACE_EVENTx macros. Do not use directly.
551class ScopedTracer {
552 public:
553 // Note: members of data_ intentionally left uninitialized. See Initialize.
554 ScopedTracer() : p_data_(nullptr) {}
38
←
3 uninitialized fields at the end of the constructor call
555
556 ~ScopedTracer() {
557 if (p_data_ && base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const base::Atomic8*>(
558 data_.category_group_enabled))) {
559 TRACE_EVENT_API_UPDATE_TRACE_EVENT_DURATIONv8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->UpdateTraceEventDuration(
560 data_.category_group_enabled, data_.name, data_.event_handle);
561 }
562 }
563
564 void Initialize(const uint8_t* category_group_enabled, const char* name,
565 uint64_t event_handle) {
566 data_.category_group_enabled = category_group_enabled;
567 data_.name = name;
568 data_.event_handle = event_handle;
569 p_data_ = &data_;
570 }
571
572 private:
573 // This Data struct workaround is to avoid initializing all the members
574 // in Data during construction of this object, since this object is always
575 // constructed, even when tracing is disabled. If the members of Data were
576 // members of this class instead, compiler warnings occur about potential
577 // uninitialized accesses.
578 struct Data {
579 const uint8_t* category_group_enabled;
uninitialized pointer 'this->data_.category_group_enabled'
580 const char* name;
uninitialized pointer 'this->data_.name'
581 uint64_t event_handle;
uninitialized field 'this->data_.event_handle'
582 };
583 Data* p_data_;
584 Data data_;
585};
586
587// Do not use directly.
588class CallStatsScopedTracer {
589 public:
590 CallStatsScopedTracer() : p_data_(nullptr) {}
591 ~CallStatsScopedTracer() {
592 if (V8_UNLIKELY(p_data_ && *data_.category_group_enabled)(__builtin_expect(!!(p_data_ && *data_.category_group_enabled
), 0))) {
593 AddEndTraceEvent();
594 }
595 }
596
597 void Initialize(v8::internal::Isolate* isolate,
598 const uint8_t* category_group_enabled, const char* name);
599
600 private:
601 void AddEndTraceEvent();
602 struct Data {
603 const uint8_t* category_group_enabled;
604 const char* name;
605 v8::internal::Isolate* isolate;
606 };
607 bool has_parent_scope_;
608 Data* p_data_;
609 Data data_;
610};
611
612} // namespace tracing
613} // namespace internal
614} // namespace v8
615
616#else // defined(V8_USE_PERFETTO)
617
618#define TRACE_EVENT_CALL_STATS_SCOPED(isolate, category, name)static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic618 = 0;
const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled618;
trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled618 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic618
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled618) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled618
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled(category); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic618), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled618
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::CallStatsScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer618
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled618)
) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { trace_event_unique_tracer618 .Initialize(isolate, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled618
, name); } \
619 struct PERFETTO_UID(ScopedEvent) { \
620 struct ScopedStats { \
621 ScopedStats(v8::internal::Isolate* isolate_arg, int) { \
622 TRACE_EVENT_BEGIN(category, name, [&](perfetto::EventContext) { \
623 isolate_ = isolate_arg; \
624 internal::RuntimeCallStats* table = \
625 isolate_->counters()->runtime_call_stats(); \
626 has_parent_scope_ = table->InUse(); \
627 if (!has_parent_scope_) table->Reset(); \
628 }); \
629 } \
630 ~ScopedStats() { \
631 TRACE_EVENT_END(category, [&](perfetto::EventContext ctx) { \
632 if (!has_parent_scope_ && isolate_) { \
633 /* TODO(skyostil): Write as typed event instead of JSON */ \
634 auto value = v8::tracing::TracedValue::Create(); \
635 isolate_->counters()->runtime_call_stats()->Dump(value.get()); \
636 auto annotation = ctx.event()->add_debug_annotations(); \
637 annotation->set_name("runtime-call-stats"); \
638 value->Add(annotation); \
639 } \
640 }); \
641 } \
642 v8::internal::Isolate* isolate_; \
643 bool has_parent_scope_; \
644 } stats; \
645 } PERFETTO_UID(scoped_event) { \
646 { isolate, 0 } \
647 }
648
649#endif // defined(V8_USE_PERFETTO)

651#endif // V8_TRACING_TRACE_EVENT_H_

52namespace v8 {
53namespace internal {
54
55const char* Marking::kWhiteBitPattern = "00";
56const char* Marking::kBlackBitPattern = "11";
57const char* Marking::kGreyBitPattern = "10";
58const char* Marking::kImpossibleBitPattern = "01";
59
60// The following has to hold in order for {MarkingState::MarkBitFrom} to not
61// produce invalid {kImpossibleBitPattern} in the marking bitmap by overlapping.
62STATIC_ASSERT(Heap::kMinObjectSizeInTaggedWords >= 2)static_assert(Heap::kMinObjectSizeInTaggedWords >= 2, "Heap::kMinObjectSizeInTaggedWords >= 2"
);
63
64// =============================================================================
65// Verifiers
66// =============================================================================
67
68#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
69namespace {
70
71class MarkingVerifier : public ObjectVisitor, public RootVisitor {
72 public:
73 virtual void Run() = 0;
74
75 protected:
76 explicit MarkingVerifier(Heap* heap) : heap_(heap) {}
77
78 virtual ConcurrentBitmap<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>* bitmap(
79 const MemoryChunk* chunk) = 0;
80
81 virtual void VerifyPointers(ObjectSlot start, ObjectSlot end) = 0;
82 virtual void VerifyPointers(MaybeObjectSlot start, MaybeObjectSlot end) = 0;
83 virtual void VerifyRootPointers(FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) = 0;
84
85 virtual bool IsMarked(HeapObject object) = 0;
86
87 virtual bool IsBlackOrGrey(HeapObject object) = 0;
88
89 void VisitPointers(HeapObject host, ObjectSlot start,
90 ObjectSlot end) override {
91 VerifyPointers(start, end);
92 }
93
94 void VisitPointers(HeapObject host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
95 MaybeObjectSlot end) override {
96 VerifyPointers(start, end);
97 }
98
99 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
100 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
101 VerifyRootPointers(start, end);
102 }
103
104 void VerifyRoots();
105 void VerifyMarkingOnPage(const Page* page, Address start, Address end);
106 void VerifyMarking(NewSpace* new_space);
107 void VerifyMarking(PagedSpace* paged_space);
108 void VerifyMarking(LargeObjectSpace* lo_space);
109
110 Heap* heap_;
111};
112
113void MarkingVerifier::VerifyRoots() {
114 heap_->IterateRoots(this, base::EnumSet<SkipRoot>{SkipRoot::kWeak});
115}
116
117void MarkingVerifier::VerifyMarkingOnPage(const Page* page, Address start,
118 Address end) {
119 HeapObject object;
120 Address next_object_must_be_here_or_later = start;
121 for (Address current = start; current < end;) {
122 object = HeapObject::FromAddress(current);
123 // One word fillers at the end of a black area can be grey.
124 if (IsBlackOrGrey(object) &&
125 object.map() != ReadOnlyRoots(heap_).one_pointer_filler_map()) {
126 CHECK(IsMarked(object))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(IsMarked(object))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "IsMarked(object)"); } } while (false);
127 CHECK(current >= next_object_must_be_here_or_later)do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(current >= next_object_must_be_here_or_later
)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "current >= next_object_must_be_here_or_later"
); } } while (false);
128 object.Iterate(this);
129 next_object_must_be_here_or_later = current + object.Size();
130 // The object is either part of a black area of black allocation or a
131 // regular black object
132 CHECK(do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex
(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page
->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)
))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later))"
); } } while (false)
133 bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange(do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex
(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page
->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)
))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later))"
); } } while (false)
134 page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current),do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex
(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page
->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)
))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later))"
); } } while (false)
135 page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) ||do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex
(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page
->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)
))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later))"
); } } while (false)
136 bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange(do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex
(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page
->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)
))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later))"
); } } while (false)
137 page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2),do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex
(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page
->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)
))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later))"
); } } while (false)
138 page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex
(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange
( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page
->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)
))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "bitmap(page)->AllBitsSetInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later)) || bitmap(page)->AllBitsClearInRange( page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(current + kTaggedSize * 2), page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(next_object_must_be_here_or_later))"
); } } while (false);
139 current = next_object_must_be_here_or_later;
140 } else {
141 current += kTaggedSize;
142 }
143 }
144}
145
146void MarkingVerifier::VerifyMarking(NewSpace* space) {
147 Address end = space->top();
148 // The bottom position is at the start of its page. Allows us to use
149 // page->area_start() as start of range on all pages.
150 CHECK_EQ(space->first_allocatable_address(),do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(space->first_allocatable_address
())>::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype
(space->first_page()->area_start())>::type>((space
->first_allocatable_address()), (space->first_page()->
area_start())); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)), 0))) {
V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "space->first_allocatable_address()"
" " "==" " " "space->first_page()->area_start()"); } }
while (false); } while (false)
151 space->first_page()->area_start())do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(space->first_allocatable_address
())>::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype
(space->first_page()->area_start())>::type>((space
->first_allocatable_address()), (space->first_page()->
area_start())); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)), 0))) {
V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "space->first_allocatable_address()"
" " "==" " " "space->first_page()->area_start()"); } }
while (false); } while (false);
152
153 PageRange range(space->first_allocatable_address(), end);
154 for (auto it = range.begin(); it != range.end();) {
155 Page* page = *(it++);
156 Address limit = it != range.end() ? page->area_end() : end;
157 CHECK(limit == end || !page->Contains(end))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(limit == end || !page->Contains
(end))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "limit == end || !page->Contains(end)"
); } } while (false);
158 VerifyMarkingOnPage(page, page->area_start(), limit);
159 }
160}
161
162void MarkingVerifier::VerifyMarking(PagedSpace* space) {
163 for (Page* p : *space) {
164 VerifyMarkingOnPage(p, p->area_start(), p->area_end());
165 }
166}
167
168void MarkingVerifier::VerifyMarking(LargeObjectSpace* lo_space) {
169 LargeObjectSpaceObjectIterator it(lo_space);
170 for (HeapObject obj = it.Next(); !obj.is_null(); obj = it.Next()) {
171 if (IsBlackOrGrey(obj)) {
172 obj.Iterate(this);
173 }
174 }
175}
176
177class FullMarkingVerifier : public MarkingVerifier {
178 public:
179 explicit FullMarkingVerifier(Heap* heap)
180 : MarkingVerifier(heap),
181 marking_state_(
182 heap->mark_compact_collector()->non_atomic_marking_state()) {}
183
184 void Run() override {
185 VerifyRoots();
186 VerifyMarking(heap_->new_space());
187 VerifyMarking(heap_->new_lo_space());
188 VerifyMarking(heap_->old_space());
189 VerifyMarking(heap_->code_space());
190 VerifyMarking(heap_->map_space());
191 VerifyMarking(heap_->lo_space());
192 VerifyMarking(heap_->code_lo_space());
193 }
194
195 protected:
196 ConcurrentBitmap<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>* bitmap(
197 const MemoryChunk* chunk) override {
198 return marking_state_->bitmap(chunk);
199 }
200
201 bool IsMarked(HeapObject object) override {
202 return marking_state_->IsBlack(object);
203 }
204
205 bool IsBlackOrGrey(HeapObject object) override {
206 return marking_state_->IsBlackOrGrey(object);
207 }
208
209 void VerifyPointers(ObjectSlot start, ObjectSlot end) override {
210 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
211 }
212
213 void VerifyPointers(MaybeObjectSlot start, MaybeObjectSlot end) override {
214 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
215 }
216
217 void VerifyRootPointers(FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
218 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
219 }
220
221 void VisitCodeTarget(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
222 Code target = Code::GetCodeFromTargetAddress(rinfo->target_address());
223 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(target);
224 }
225
226 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
227 DCHECK(RelocInfo::IsEmbeddedObjectMode(rinfo->rmode()))((void) 0);
228 if (!host.IsWeakObject(rinfo->target_object())) {
229 HeapObject object = rinfo->target_object();
230 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(object);
231 }
232 }
233
234 private:
235 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void VerifyHeapObjectImpl(HeapObject heap_object) {
236 CHECK(marking_state_->IsBlackOrGrey(heap_object))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(marking_state_->IsBlackOrGrey
(heap_object))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "marking_state_->IsBlackOrGrey(heap_object)"
); } } while (false);
237 }
238
239 template <typename TSlot>
240 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void VerifyPointersImpl(TSlot start, TSlot end) {
241 for (TSlot slot = start; slot < end; ++slot) {
242 typename TSlot::TObject object = *slot;
243 HeapObject heap_object;
244 if (object.GetHeapObjectIfStrong(&heap_object)) {
245 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(heap_object);
246 }
247 }
248 }
249
250 MarkCompactCollector::NonAtomicMarkingState* marking_state_;
251};
252
253class EvacuationVerifier : public ObjectVisitor, public RootVisitor {
254 public:
255 virtual void Run() = 0;
256
257 void VisitPointers(HeapObject host, ObjectSlot start,
258 ObjectSlot end) override {
259 VerifyPointers(start, end);
260 }
261
262 void VisitPointers(HeapObject host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
263 MaybeObjectSlot end) override {
264 VerifyPointers(start, end);
265 }
266
267 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
268 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
269 VerifyRootPointers(start, end);
270 }
271
272 protected:
273 explicit EvacuationVerifier(Heap* heap) : heap_(heap) {}
274
275 inline Heap* heap() { return heap_; }
276
277 virtual void VerifyPointers(ObjectSlot start, ObjectSlot end) = 0;
278 virtual void VerifyPointers(MaybeObjectSlot start, MaybeObjectSlot end) = 0;
279 virtual void VerifyRootPointers(FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) = 0;
280
281 void VerifyRoots();
282 void VerifyEvacuationOnPage(Address start, Address end);
283 void VerifyEvacuation(NewSpace* new_space);
284 void VerifyEvacuation(PagedSpace* paged_space);
285
286 Heap* heap_;
287};
288
289void EvacuationVerifier::VerifyRoots() {
290 heap_->IterateRoots(this, base::EnumSet<SkipRoot>{SkipRoot::kWeak});
291}
292
293void EvacuationVerifier::VerifyEvacuationOnPage(Address start, Address end) {
294 Address current = start;
295 while (current < end) {
296 HeapObject object = HeapObject::FromAddress(current);
297 if (!object.IsFreeSpaceOrFiller()) object.Iterate(this);
298 current += object.Size();
299 }
300}
301
302void EvacuationVerifier::VerifyEvacuation(NewSpace* space) {
303 PageRange range(space->first_allocatable_address(), space->top());
304 for (auto it = range.begin(); it != range.end();) {
305 Page* page = *(it++);
306 Address current = page->area_start();
307 Address limit = it != range.end() ? page->area_end() : space->top();
308 CHECK(limit == space->top() || !page->Contains(space->top()))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(limit == space->top() || !
page->Contains(space->top()))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "limit == space->top() || !page->Contains(space->top())"
); } } while (false);
309 VerifyEvacuationOnPage(current, limit);
310 }
311}
312
313void EvacuationVerifier::VerifyEvacuation(PagedSpace* space) {
314 for (Page* p : *space) {
315 if (p->IsEvacuationCandidate()) continue;
316 if (p->Contains(space->top())) {
317 CodePageMemoryModificationScope memory_modification_scope(p);
318 heap_->CreateFillerObjectAt(
319 space->top(), static_cast<int>(space->limit() - space->top()),
320 ClearRecordedSlots::kNo);
321 }
322 VerifyEvacuationOnPage(p->area_start(), p->area_end());
323 }
324}
325
326class FullEvacuationVerifier : public EvacuationVerifier {
327 public:
328 explicit FullEvacuationVerifier(Heap* heap) : EvacuationVerifier(heap) {}
329
330 void Run() override {
331 VerifyRoots();
332 VerifyEvacuation(heap_->new_space());
333 VerifyEvacuation(heap_->old_space());
334 VerifyEvacuation(heap_->code_space());
335 VerifyEvacuation(heap_->map_space());
336 }
337
338 protected:
339 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void VerifyHeapObjectImpl(HeapObject heap_object) {
340 CHECK_IMPLIES(Heap::InYoungGeneration(heap_object),do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!(Heap::InYoungGeneration(heap_object
)) || (Heap::InToPage(heap_object)))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "Heap::InYoungGeneration(heap_object)" " implies " "Heap::InToPage(heap_object)"
); } } while (false)
341 Heap::InToPage(heap_object))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!(Heap::InYoungGeneration(heap_object
)) || (Heap::InToPage(heap_object)))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "Heap::InYoungGeneration(heap_object)" " implies " "Heap::InToPage(heap_object)"
); } } while (false);
342 CHECK(!MarkCompactCollector::IsOnEvacuationCandidate(heap_object))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!MarkCompactCollector::IsOnEvacuationCandidate
(heap_object))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "!MarkCompactCollector::IsOnEvacuationCandidate(heap_object)"
); } } while (false);
343 }
344
345 template <typename TSlot>
346 void VerifyPointersImpl(TSlot start, TSlot end) {
347 for (TSlot current = start; current < end; ++current) {
348 typename TSlot::TObject object = *current;
349 HeapObject heap_object;
350 if (object.GetHeapObjectIfStrong(&heap_object)) {
351 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(heap_object);
352 }
353 }
354 }
355
356 void VerifyPointers(ObjectSlot start, ObjectSlot end) override {
357 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
358 }
359 void VerifyPointers(MaybeObjectSlot start, MaybeObjectSlot end) override {
360 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
361 }
362 void VisitCodeTarget(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
363 Code target = Code::GetCodeFromTargetAddress(rinfo->target_address());
364 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(target);
365 }
366 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
367 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(rinfo->target_object());
368 }
369 void VerifyRootPointers(FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
370 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
371 }
372};
373
374} // namespace
375#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
376
377// =============================================================================
378// MarkCompactCollectorBase, MinorMarkCompactCollector, MarkCompactCollector
379// =============================================================================
380
381namespace {
382
383int NumberOfAvailableCores() {
384 static int num_cores = V8::GetCurrentPlatform()->NumberOfWorkerThreads() + 1;
385 // This number of cores should be greater than zero and never change.
386 DCHECK_GE(num_cores, 1)((void) 0);
387 DCHECK_EQ(num_cores, V8::GetCurrentPlatform()->NumberOfWorkerThreads() + 1)((void) 0);
388 return num_cores;
389}
390
391} // namespace
392
393int MarkCompactCollectorBase::NumberOfParallelCompactionTasks(int pages) {
394 DCHECK_GT(pages, 0)((void) 0);
395 int tasks = FLAG_parallel_compaction ? Min(NumberOfAvailableCores(),
396 pages / (MB / Page::kPageSize) + 1)
397 : 1;
398 if (!heap_->CanExpandOldGeneration(
399 static_cast<size_t>(tasks * Page::kPageSize))) {
400 // Optimize for memory usage near the heap limit.
401 tasks = 1;
402 }
403 return tasks;
404}
405
406int MarkCompactCollectorBase::NumberOfParallelPointerUpdateTasks(int pages,
407 int slots) {
408 DCHECK_GT(pages, 0)((void) 0);
409 // Limit the number of update tasks as task creation often dominates the
410 // actual work that is being done.
411 const int kMaxPointerUpdateTasks = 8;
412 const int kSlotsPerTask = 600;
413 const int wanted_tasks =
414 (slots >= 0) ? Max(1, Min(pages, slots / kSlotsPerTask)) : pages;
415 return FLAG_parallel_pointer_update
416 ? Min(kMaxPointerUpdateTasks,
417 Min(NumberOfAvailableCores(), wanted_tasks))
418 : 1;
419}
420
421int MarkCompactCollectorBase::NumberOfParallelToSpacePointerUpdateTasks(
422 int pages) {
423 DCHECK_GT(pages, 0)((void) 0);
424 // No cap needed because all pages we need to process are fully filled with
425 // interesting objects.
426 return FLAG_parallel_pointer_update ? Min(NumberOfAvailableCores(), pages)
427 : 1;
428}
429
430MarkCompactCollector::MarkCompactCollector(Heap* heap)
431 : MarkCompactCollectorBase(heap),
432 page_parallel_job_semaphore_(0),
433#ifdef DEBUG
434 state_(IDLE),
435#endif
436 was_marked_incrementally_(false),
437 evacuation_(false),
438 compacting_(false),
439 black_allocation_(false),
440 have_code_to_deoptimize_(false),
441 sweeper_(new Sweeper(heap, non_atomic_marking_state())) {
442 old_to_new_slots_ = -1;
443}
444
445MarkCompactCollector::~MarkCompactCollector() { delete sweeper_; }
446
447void MarkCompactCollector::SetUp() {
448 DCHECK_EQ(0, strcmp(Marking::kWhiteBitPattern, "00"))((void) 0);
449 DCHECK_EQ(0, strcmp(Marking::kBlackBitPattern, "11"))((void) 0);
450 DCHECK_EQ(0, strcmp(Marking::kGreyBitPattern, "10"))((void) 0);
451 DCHECK_EQ(0, strcmp(Marking::kImpossibleBitPattern, "01"))((void) 0);
452}
453
454void MarkCompactCollector::TearDown() {
455 AbortCompaction();
456 AbortWeakObjects();
457 if (heap()->incremental_marking()->IsMarking()) {
458 local_marking_worklists()->Publish();
459 marking_worklists()->Clear();
460 }
461}
462
463void MarkCompactCollector::AddEvacuationCandidate(Page* p) {
464 DCHECK(!p->NeverEvacuate())((void) 0);
465
466 if (FLAG_trace_evacuation_candidates) {
467 PrintIsolate(
468 isolate(),
469 "Evacuation candidate: Free bytes: %6zu. Free Lists length: %4d.\n",
470 p->area_size() - p->allocated_bytes(), p->FreeListsLength());
471 }
472
473 p->MarkEvacuationCandidate();
474 evacuation_candidates_.push_back(p);
475}
476
477static void TraceFragmentation(PagedSpace* space) {
478 int number_of_pages = space->CountTotalPages();
479 intptr_t reserved = (number_of_pages * space->AreaSize());
480 intptr_t free = reserved - space->SizeOfObjects();
481 PrintF("[%s]: %d pages, %d (%.1f%%) free\n", space->name(), number_of_pages,
482 static_cast<int>(free), static_cast<double>(free) * 100 / reserved);
483}
484
485bool MarkCompactCollector::StartCompaction() {
486 if (!compacting_) {
487 DCHECK(evacuation_candidates_.empty())((void) 0);
488
489 if (FLAG_gc_experiment_less_compaction && !heap_->ShouldReduceMemory())
490 return false;
491
492 CollectEvacuationCandidates(heap()->old_space());
493
494 if (FLAG_compact_code_space) {
495 CollectEvacuationCandidates(heap()->code_space());
496 } else if (FLAG_trace_fragmentation) {
497 TraceFragmentation(heap()->code_space());
498 }
499
500 if (FLAG_trace_fragmentation) {
501 TraceFragmentation(heap()->map_space());
502 }
503
504 compacting_ = !evacuation_candidates_.empty();
505 }
506
507 return compacting_;
508}
509
510void MarkCompactCollector::StartMarking() {
511 if (FLAG_concurrent_marking || FLAG_parallel_marking) {
512 heap_->new_lo_space()->ResetPendingObject();
513 }
514 std::vector<Address> contexts =
515 heap()->memory_measurement()->StartProcessing();
516 if (FLAG_stress_per_context_marking_worklist) {
517 contexts.clear();
518 HandleScope handle_scope(heap()->isolate());
519 for (auto context : heap()->FindAllNativeContexts()) {
520 contexts.push_back(context->ptr());
521 }
522 }
523 marking_worklists()->CreateContextWorklists(contexts);
524 local_marking_worklists_ =
525 std::make_unique<MarkingWorklists::Local>(marking_worklists());
526 marking_visitor_ = std::make_unique<MarkingVisitor>(
527 marking_state(), local_marking_worklists(), weak_objects(), heap_,
528 epoch(), Heap::GetBytecodeFlushMode(),
529 heap_->local_embedder_heap_tracer()->InUse(),
530 heap_->is_current_gc_forced());
531// Marking bits are cleared by the sweeper.
532#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
533 if (FLAG_verify_heap) {
534 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean();
535 }
536#endif
537}
538
539void MarkCompactCollector::CollectGarbage() {
540 // Make sure that Prepare() has been called. The individual steps below will
541 // update the state as they proceed.
542 DCHECK(state_ == PREPARE_GC)((void) 0);
543
544#ifdef ENABLE_MINOR_MC1
545 heap()->minor_mark_compact_collector()->CleanupSweepToIteratePages();
546#endif // ENABLE_MINOR_MC
547
548 MarkLiveObjects();
549 ClearNonLiveReferences();
550 VerifyMarking();
551 heap()->memory_measurement()->FinishProcessing(native_context_stats_);
552 RecordObjectStats();
553
554 StartSweepSpaces();
555 Evacuate();
556 Finish();
557}
558
559#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
560void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyMarkbitsAreDirty(ReadOnlySpace* space) {
561 ReadOnlyHeapObjectIterator iterator(space);
562 for (HeapObject object = iterator.Next(); !object.is_null();
563 object = iterator.Next()) {
564 CHECK(non_atomic_marking_state()->IsBlack(object))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(non_atomic_marking_state()->
IsBlack(object))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "non_atomic_marking_state()->IsBlack(object)"
); } } while (false);
565 }
566}
567
568void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(PagedSpace* space) {
569 for (Page* p : *space) {
570 CHECK(non_atomic_marking_state()->bitmap(p)->IsClean())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(non_atomic_marking_state()->
bitmap(p)->IsClean())), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "non_atomic_marking_state()->bitmap(p)->IsClean()"); }
} while (false);
571 CHECK_EQ(0, non_atomic_marking_state()->live_bytes(p))do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(0)>::type, typename ::v8::
base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(non_atomic_marking_state(
)->live_bytes(p))>::type>((0), (non_atomic_marking_state
()->live_bytes(p))); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)
), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "0" " " "==" " " "non_atomic_marking_state()->live_bytes(p)"
); } } while (false); } while (false);
572 }
573}
574
575void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(NewSpace* space) {
576 for (Page* p : PageRange(space->first_allocatable_address(), space->top())) {
577 CHECK(non_atomic_marking_state()->bitmap(p)->IsClean())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(non_atomic_marking_state()->
bitmap(p)->IsClean())), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "non_atomic_marking_state()->bitmap(p)->IsClean()"); }
} while (false);
578 CHECK_EQ(0, non_atomic_marking_state()->live_bytes(p))do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(0)>::type, typename ::v8::
base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(non_atomic_marking_state(
)->live_bytes(p))>::type>((0), (non_atomic_marking_state
()->live_bytes(p))); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)
), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "0" " " "==" " " "non_atomic_marking_state()->live_bytes(p)"
); } } while (false); } while (false);
579 }
580}
581
582void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(LargeObjectSpace* space) {
583 LargeObjectSpaceObjectIterator it(space);
584 for (HeapObject obj = it.Next(); !obj.is_null(); obj = it.Next()) {
585 CHECK(non_atomic_marking_state()->IsWhite(obj))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(non_atomic_marking_state()->
IsWhite(obj))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "non_atomic_marking_state()->IsWhite(obj)"
); } } while (false);
586 CHECK_EQ(0, non_atomic_marking_state()->live_bytes(do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(0)>::type, typename ::v8::
base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(non_atomic_marking_state(
)->live_bytes( MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(obj)))>::type
>((0), (non_atomic_marking_state()->live_bytes( MemoryChunk
::FromHeapObject(obj)))); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp
)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "0" " " "==" " " "non_atomic_marking_state()->live_bytes( MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(obj))"
); } } while (false); } while (false)
587 MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(obj)))do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(0)>::type, typename ::v8::
base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(non_atomic_marking_state(
)->live_bytes( MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(obj)))>::type
>((0), (non_atomic_marking_state()->live_bytes( MemoryChunk
::FromHeapObject(obj)))); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp
)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "0" " " "==" " " "non_atomic_marking_state()->live_bytes( MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(obj))"
); } } while (false); } while (false);
588 }
589}
590
591void MarkCompactCollector::VerifyMarkbitsAreClean() {
592 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->old_space());
593 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->code_space());
594 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->map_space());
595 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->new_space());
596 // Read-only space should always be black since we never collect any objects
597 // in it or linked from it.
598 VerifyMarkbitsAreDirty(heap_->read_only_space());
599 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->lo_space());
600 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->code_lo_space());
601 VerifyMarkbitsAreClean(heap_->new_lo_space());
602}
603
604#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
605
606void MarkCompactCollector::EnsureSweepingCompleted() {
607 if (!sweeper()->sweeping_in_progress()) return;
608
609 sweeper()->EnsureCompleted();
610 heap()->old_space()->RefillFreeList();
611 heap()->code_space()->RefillFreeList();
612 heap()->map_space()->RefillFreeList();
613 heap()->map_space()->SortFreeList();
614
615 heap()->tracer()->NotifySweepingCompleted();
616
617#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
618 if (FLAG_verify_heap && !evacuation()) {
619 FullEvacuationVerifier verifier(heap());
620 verifier.Run();
621 }
622#endif
623}
624
625void MarkCompactCollector::DrainSweepingWorklists() {
626 if (!sweeper()->sweeping_in_progress()) return;
627 sweeper()->DrainSweepingWorklists();
628}
629
630void MarkCompactCollector::DrainSweepingWorklistForSpace(
631 AllocationSpace space) {
632 if (!sweeper()->sweeping_in_progress()) return;
633 sweeper()->DrainSweepingWorklistForSpace(space);
634}
635
636void MarkCompactCollector::ComputeEvacuationHeuristics(
637 size_t area_size, int* target_fragmentation_percent,
638 size_t* max_evacuated_bytes) {
639 // For memory reducing and optimize for memory mode we directly define both
640 // constants.
641 const int kTargetFragmentationPercentForReduceMemory = 20;
642 const size_t kMaxEvacuatedBytesForReduceMemory = 12 * MB;
643 const int kTargetFragmentationPercentForOptimizeMemory = 20;
644 const size_t kMaxEvacuatedBytesForOptimizeMemory = 6 * MB;
645
646 // For regular mode (which is latency critical) we define less aggressive
647 // defaults to start and switch to a trace-based (using compaction speed)
648 // approach as soon as we have enough samples.
649 const int kTargetFragmentationPercent = 70;
650 const size_t kMaxEvacuatedBytes = 4 * MB;
651 // Time to take for a single area (=payload of page). Used as soon as there
652 // exist enough compaction speed samples.
653 const float kTargetMsPerArea = .5;
654
655 if (heap()->ShouldReduceMemory()) {
656 *target_fragmentation_percent = kTargetFragmentationPercentForReduceMemory;
657 *max_evacuated_bytes = kMaxEvacuatedBytesForReduceMemory;
658 } else if (heap()->ShouldOptimizeForMemoryUsage()) {
659 *target_fragmentation_percent =
660 kTargetFragmentationPercentForOptimizeMemory;
661 *max_evacuated_bytes = kMaxEvacuatedBytesForOptimizeMemory;
662 } else {
663 const double estimated_compaction_speed =
664 heap()->tracer()->CompactionSpeedInBytesPerMillisecond();
665 if (estimated_compaction_speed != 0) {
666 // Estimate the target fragmentation based on traced compaction speed
667 // and a goal for a single page.
668 const double estimated_ms_per_area =
669 1 + area_size / estimated_compaction_speed;
670 *target_fragmentation_percent = static_cast<int>(
671 100 - 100 * kTargetMsPerArea / estimated_ms_per_area);
672 if (*target_fragmentation_percent <
673 kTargetFragmentationPercentForReduceMemory) {
674 *target_fragmentation_percent =
675 kTargetFragmentationPercentForReduceMemory;
676 }
677 } else {
678 *target_fragmentation_percent = kTargetFragmentationPercent;
679 }
680 *max_evacuated_bytes = kMaxEvacuatedBytes;
681 }
682}
683
684void MarkCompactCollector::CollectEvacuationCandidates(PagedSpace* space) {
685 DCHECK(space->identity() == OLD_SPACE || space->identity() == CODE_SPACE)((void) 0);
686
687 int number_of_pages = space->CountTotalPages();
688 size_t area_size = space->AreaSize();
689
690 const bool in_standard_path =
691 !(FLAG_manual_evacuation_candidates_selection ||
692 FLAG_stress_compaction_random || FLAG_stress_compaction ||
693 FLAG_always_compact);
694 // Those variables will only be initialized if |in_standard_path|, and are not
695 // used otherwise.
696 size_t max_evacuated_bytes;
697 int target_fragmentation_percent;
698 size_t free_bytes_threshold;
699 if (in_standard_path) {
700 // We use two conditions to decide whether a page qualifies as an evacuation
701 // candidate, or not:
702 // * Target fragmentation: How fragmented is a page, i.e., how is the ratio
703 // between live bytes and capacity of this page (= area).
704 // * Evacuation quota: A global quota determining how much bytes should be
705 // compacted.
706 ComputeEvacuationHeuristics(area_size, &target_fragmentation_percent,
707 &max_evacuated_bytes);
708 free_bytes_threshold = target_fragmentation_percent * (area_size / 100);
709 }
710
711 // Pairs of (live_bytes_in_page, page).
712 using LiveBytesPagePair = std::pair<size_t, Page*>;
713 std::vector<LiveBytesPagePair> pages;
714 pages.reserve(number_of_pages);
715
716 DCHECK(!sweeping_in_progress())((void) 0);
717 Page* owner_of_linear_allocation_area =
718 space->top() == space->limit()
719 ? nullptr
720 : Page::FromAllocationAreaAddress(space->top());
721 for (Page* p : *space) {
722 if (p->NeverEvacuate() || (p == owner_of_linear_allocation_area) ||
723 !p->CanAllocate())
724 continue;
725
726 if (p->IsPinned()) {
727 DCHECK(((void) 0)
728 !p->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::FORCE_EVACUATION_CANDIDATE_FOR_TESTING))((void) 0);
729 continue;
730 }
731
732 // Invariant: Evacuation candidates are just created when marking is
733 // started. This means that sweeping has finished. Furthermore, at the end
734 // of a GC all evacuation candidates are cleared and their slot buffers are
735 // released.
736 CHECK(!p->IsEvacuationCandidate())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!p->IsEvacuationCandidate(
))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "!p->IsEvacuationCandidate()"
); } } while (false);
737 CHECK_NULL(p->slot_set<OLD_TO_OLD>())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!((p->slot_set<OLD_TO_OLD
>()) == nullptr)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "(p->slot_set<OLD_TO_OLD>()) == nullptr"
); } } while (false);
738 CHECK_NULL(p->typed_slot_set<OLD_TO_OLD>())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!((p->typed_slot_set<OLD_TO_OLD
>()) == nullptr)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "(p->typed_slot_set<OLD_TO_OLD>()) == nullptr"
); } } while (false);
739 CHECK(p->SweepingDone())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(p->SweepingDone())), 0))) {
V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "p->SweepingDone()"); } } while
(false);
740 DCHECK(p->area_size() == area_size)((void) 0);
741 if (in_standard_path) {
742 // Only the pages with at more than |free_bytes_threshold| free bytes are
743 // considered for evacuation.
744 if (area_size - p->allocated_bytes() >= free_bytes_threshold) {
745 pages.push_back(std::make_pair(p->allocated_bytes(), p));
746 }
747 } else {
748 pages.push_back(std::make_pair(p->allocated_bytes(), p));
749 }
750 }
751
752 int candidate_count = 0;
753 size_t total_live_bytes = 0;
754
755 const bool reduce_memory = heap()->ShouldReduceMemory();
756 if (FLAG_manual_evacuation_candidates_selection) {
757 for (size_t i = 0; i < pages.size(); i++) {
758 Page* p = pages[i].second;
759 if (p->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::FORCE_EVACUATION_CANDIDATE_FOR_TESTING)) {
760 candidate_count++;
761 total_live_bytes += pages[i].first;
762 p->ClearFlag(MemoryChunk::FORCE_EVACUATION_CANDIDATE_FOR_TESTING);
763 AddEvacuationCandidate(p);
764 }
765 }
766 } else if (FLAG_stress_compaction_random) {
767 double fraction = isolate()->fuzzer_rng()->NextDouble();
768 size_t pages_to_mark_count =
769 static_cast<size_t>(fraction * (pages.size() + 1));
770 for (uint64_t i : isolate()->fuzzer_rng()->NextSample(
771 pages.size(), pages_to_mark_count)) {
772 candidate_count++;
773 total_live_bytes += pages[i].first;
774 AddEvacuationCandidate(pages[i].second);
775 }
776 } else if (FLAG_stress_compaction) {
777 for (size_t i = 0; i < pages.size(); i++) {
778 Page* p = pages[i].second;
779 if (i % 2 == 0) {
780 candidate_count++;
781 total_live_bytes += pages[i].first;
782 AddEvacuationCandidate(p);
783 }
784 }
785 } else {
786 // The following approach determines the pages that should be evacuated.
787 //
788 // Sort pages from the most free to the least free, then select
789 // the first n pages for evacuation such that:
790 // - the total size of evacuated objects does not exceed the specified
791 // limit.
792 // - fragmentation of (n+1)-th page does not exceed the specified limit.
793 std::sort(pages.begin(), pages.end(),
794 [](const LiveBytesPagePair& a, const LiveBytesPagePair& b) {
795 return a.first < b.first;
796 });
797 for (size_t i = 0; i < pages.size(); i++) {
798 size_t live_bytes = pages[i].first;
799 DCHECK_GE(area_size, live_bytes)((void) 0);
800 if (FLAG_always_compact ||
801 ((total_live_bytes + live_bytes) <= max_evacuated_bytes)) {
802 candidate_count++;
803 total_live_bytes += live_bytes;
804 }
805 if (FLAG_trace_fragmentation_verbose) {
